p: More recently, also glycosylation has been proposed to be involved in regulation of the transport function. Mutations in the glycosylation sites (see N 176, N 181, N 184 in Fig. 8.4) indeed lead to altered transport. The example illustrated in Fig. 8.5 shows that mutation of two of the three asparagines (N) to aspartic acid (D) leads to reduced sensitivity for extracellular Na +.
